fields.summary: VPC Error releasing private IP address X for eni-Y

comments.body: A workaround may be to configure a higher number of retries on optimistic locking failure.
Is this possibly related to failures, perhaps related to disks filling up, seen on the scale system with VPC?
Yes, I've seen this on scale VPC system.

We should never fail due to being unable to update the free addresses for a subnet. We may want to increase the retries for the transaction (rather than using the default of 10) but should also catch/log any failure. If an update fails then the free addresses could be wrong until another private address is allocated or released for the subnet.
We now log a warning if updating the free addresses for a subnet fails.
I'll look for the new log message, but a little unclear on how to set up the failure case. Sounds like I need to test on scale system, at least.
[~dkavanagh], to avoid needing instance capacity you could test by concurrently allocating network interfaces rather than running instances.
[~dkavanagh], yes we support the CreateNetworkInterface action. You could also use the related euca-create-network-interface euca2ools command.
[~dkavanagh], [~vasya] may be able to say what the concurrency was when he saw the issue. I would think creating 20 network interfaces in the same subnet concurrently would be a good test.
I can't say for sure but I guess I was starting hundreds of instances on the scale set up while I've noticed this issue.
Assuming I'm not going to coordinate multiple calls to create network interfaces, it seems like creating 20 instances with 1 API call might be better.
Launching 20 instances with a single action/call would not reproduce the reported issue.

I verified this by creating 30 network interfaces as Steve suggested.
That worked well. I then ran a script do delete them all (thereby freeing the private addresses) and that worked as well.
